oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Chet Atkins - Parts 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Chet Atkins (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 1, 2 and 3. Recording is from November 21, 1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:06) Chet Atkins radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:29) Chet Atkins radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:47) East Tennessee Christmas [excerpt] [featuring Emery introduction] (Chet Atkins) -- (01:12) Atkins and Ralph Emery discuss the last time Atkins performed a Christmas album, and both discuss "Jingle Bell Rock" -- (03:24) Emery inquires about the time frame for re-recording a track -- (03:52) Atkins is invited to his inspiration to "East Tennessee Christmas" -- (06:51) Emery and Atkins discuss their impressions of Lefty Frizzell and Sylvia -- (07:58) Emery invites Atkins to discuss Don Williams' vocal styling -- (08:59) Emery recalls a time he was with Williams in England, and Atkins discusses how he played "Cascade" in England -- (11:30) Emery inquires about Atkins experience in England and Atkins praises Pat Campbell -- (12:06) Atkins reflects on his various international fan clubs, interacts with them, and Emery reflects on some goof fan clubs -- (14:58) Emery inquires about Atkins' attention to pitch and Atkins praises Ricky Skaggs -- (16:32) Emery describes the process of distributing the contents of Atkins' album over the five interviews -- (17:34) East Tennessee Christmas [featuring Emery outro] (Chet Atkins) -- (19:11) East Tennessee Christmas [excerpt] [featuring Chet Atkins and Ralph Emery introduction] (Chet Atkins) -- (19:35) Emery and Atkins discuss how much they enjoy radio -- (21:18) Emery inquires about what Atkins does around the Christmas time while discussing "East Tennessee Christmas" -- (22:42) The success of Mel Torme's "The Christmas Song" is reflected on -- (24:15) Emery expresses his praise for the Salvation Army -- (25:27) Emery inquires about Atkins' time producing Dottie West -- (27:41) Atkins expresses his interest in performing jazz while discussing Kenny Rogers "My Favorite Things" -- (28:24) Emery introduces the Statler Brothers' "Jingle Bells," and Atkins shows his appreciation for their endeavors -- (29:48) Atkins describes the structure of "God Rest Ye Merry Gentlemen" -- (31:39) Emery compares Christmas songs to folk songs and Emery invites Atkins to discuss Ronnie Milsap -- (33:09) Emery invites Atkins to discuss the time he and Roy Acuff introduces Olivia Newton-John at the CMA Awards -- (34:39) Emery have Atkins discuss the success of the Everly Brothers and the early moments of recording with them -- (37:34) East Tennessee Christmas [featuring Emery and Atkins outro] (Chet Atkins) -- (39:13) East Tennessee Christmas [excerpt] [featuring Emery and Atkins introduction] (Chet Atkins) -- (39:37) Emery introduces Jerry Reed's "Christmas Time's a Comin'" -- (40:23) Emery inquires what Atkins wants for Christmas and what camera he has -- (43:50) "Run Don't Walk" is discussed by Atkins and Emery -- (44:27) Emery questions Atkins about his shopping habits overseas, and Atkins' health -- (47:05) Atkins expresses his appreciation for Charley Pride, and Emery inquires about the number of recordings Atkins performed for the album -- (48:50) Emery expresses his disbelief that Atkins enjoys 'love movies' -- (52:14) Emery and Atkins reflect on a feeling of age -- (52:49) Atkins and Emery discuss Moe Bandy and his previous occupation -- (53:17) Emery and Atkins have conflicting beliefs of who first recorded "Freight Train" -- (54:28) East Tennessee Christmas [excerpt] [featuring Emery and Atkins outro] (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Atkins, Chet;
